bibl.title: Women of Jeme. Lives in a Coptic Town in Late Antique Egypt. (New Texts from Ancient Cultures.)
bibl.note: Preface. - Introduction: The Town of Jeme in the Seventh and Eighth Centuries CE. - 1. Saints, Sinners, and Women of Jeme: Literary Ideals and Documentary Realities. - 2. Elizabeth and an Abigaia or Two: Some Women of Jeme. - 3. Elizabeth and Abigaia in Context: Women's Lives in Family and Community. - 4. Donors, Monastics, Worshippers: Women's Lives and Religion. - 5. Koloje the Moneylender and Other Women in the Economy of Jeme. - Epilogue: Harriet Martineau at Jeme, 1846. - Glossary. Bibliography. Index of Texts Cited. General Index.
bibl.seg: WILFONG T.G., Women of Jeme. Lives in a Coptic Town in Late Antique Egypt. (New Texts from Ancient Cultures.)
Ann Arbor, University of Michigan Press, 2003, 8Â°, xxvi-192 pp., 8 figg. et 4 pll. ISBN 0-472-06612-9. $24.95.

Preface. - Introduction: The Town of Jeme in the Seventh and Eighth Centuries CE. - 1. Saints, Sinners, and Women of Jeme: Literary Ideals and Documentary Realities. - 2. Elizabeth and an Abigaia or Two: Some Women of Jeme. - 3. Elizabeth and Abigaia in Context: Women's Lives in Family and Community. - 4. Donors, Monastics, Worshippers: Women's Lives and Religion. - 5. Koloje the Moneylender and Other Women in the Economy of Jeme. - Epilogue: Harriet Martineau at Jeme, 1846. - Glossary. Bibliography. Index of Texts Cited. General Index.
C.R. par Rebecca Krawiec, JNES 68 (2009) pp. 324-326.
